intro: Herniaria permixta, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems covered in small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas or disturbed habitats. Herniaria permixta is known for its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in arid or coastal environments.
